rename.from: see if sklearn graph search is faster than conversion to networkx for LCC check
rename.to: see if other graph searches are faster than conversion to networkx for LCC check

body:
https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/blob/7b136e9/sklearn/manifold/spectral_embedding_.py#L340

looks like sklearn version calls the scipy one if sparse and has a custom thingy for dense. Could be useful for us
@kareef928 may also be of interest (semi related to #485)
Sure, I think I need a bit of guidance to understand what I am actually doing
for sure! we would have to talk about it. long story short this function gets called for all of our embeddings and right now the way that we do it is super slow.

DoD:

- Implement scipy connected_components function for LCC check in utils

- Add check_LCC_scipy parameter to ASE that checks for LCC using connected_components

- Run simulation on unconnected ER graph to determine if LCC check is faster using original graph search or scipy connected_components function

1. Create undirected ER graph (called A) with N vertices and P matrix

2. Adjust graph so one vertex is alone

3. Get time it takes for ASE to run on A using check_LCC and check_LCC_scipy with timeit

4. Do 20 trials of steps 2-3

5. Increase N and repeat steps 1-4

6. Make two seaborn stripplots:
first plot y: times of ASE using check_LCC and x: number of vertices
second plot y: times of ASE using check_LCC scipy and x: number of vertices

- Push the fastest graph search method (probably scipy connected_components)
IMO this one is top priority for making things faster cause this affects LDT also.
Ok, I still need to iron out some details with this issue so we can talk about that on Friday

issue.title: Refactor LCC check and n_features_ attribute setting to BaseEmbed
issue.body:
ASE/LSE fit have some redundant code that could be in base

see #462

issue.title: [BUG] Layouts fail for directed graphs
issue.body:
## Expected Behavior
Layouts should work with directed graphs (IMO)
Perhaps not a bug in the sense that I'm not sure we promise this works for directed, but still. If we decided to only support undirected maybe a clearer error is warranted. 

## Actual Behavior
``NetworkXNotImplemented: not implemented for directed type``

## Example Code
```python
import networkx as nx
from graspologic.layouts import layout_umap

g = nx.erdos_renyi_graph(10, 0.7, directed=True)
layout_umap(g)
```

## Full Traceback
```pytb
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
NetworkXNotImplemented                    Traceback (most recent call last)
~/JHU_code/maggot/maggot_connectome/scripts/what_is_flow_rank.py in 
      3 
      4 g = nx.erdos_renyi_graph(10, 0.7, directed=True)
----> 5 layout_umap(g)

~/miniconda3/envs/maggot-revamp/lib/python3.8/site-packages/graspologic/layouts/auto.py in layout_umap(graph, min_dist, n_neighbors, max_edges, random_seed)
    173     """
    174 
--> 175     lcc_graph, tensors, labels = _node2vec_for_layout(graph, max_edges, random_seed)
    176     points = umap.UMAP(
    177         min_dist=min_dist, n_neighbors=n_neighbors, random_state=random_seed

~/miniconda3/envs/maggot-revamp/lib/python3.8/site-packages/graspologic/layouts/auto.py in _node2vec_for_layout(graph, max_edges, random_seed)
    214 ) -> Tuple[nx.Graph, np.ndarray, np.ndarray]:
    215     graph = _approximate_prune(graph, max_edges)
--> 216     graph = _largest_connected_component(graph)
    217 
    218     start = time.time()

~/miniconda3/envs/maggot-revamp/lib/python3.8/site-packages/graspologic/layouts/auto.py in _largest_connected_component(graph)
    182 
    183 def _largest_connected_component(graph: nx.Graph) -> nx.Graph:
--> 184     largest_component = max(nx.connected_components(graph), key=len)
    185     return graph.subgraph(largest_component).copy()
    186 

 in connected_components(G)

~/miniconda3/envs/maggot-revamp/lib/python3.8/site-packages/networkx/utils/decorators.py in _not_implemented_for(not_implement_for_func, *args, **kwargs)
     74         if match:
     75             msg = f"not implemented for {' '.join(graph_types)} type"
---> 76             raise nx.NetworkXNotImplemented(msg)
     77         else:
     78             return not_implement_for_func(*args, **kwargs)

NetworkXNotImplemented: not implemented for directed type
```

## Your Environment
* Python version: 3.8
* graspologic version: dev

## Additional Details
```pytb
183 def _largest_connected_component(graph: nx.Graph) -> nx.Graph:
--> 184     largest_component = max(nx.connected_components(graph), key=len)
```
Just from these 2 lines on the traceback, I suspect this just needs to be adapted to check for weakly connected components. Or, use `graspologic.utils.is_fully_connected` from our own codebase. However in #112 we are talking about replacing the networkx-based check with a faster one from scipy. Not sure if the layouts code will always assume networkx input going forward. AFAIK there is nothing that inherently needs to be undirected for the layouts process, or am I missing something?

issue.title: Implement scipy connected_components in LCC check
issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look at
the contribution guidelines: https://github.com/microsoft/graspologic/blob/dev/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.
Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->
Closes #112 
#### What does this implement/fix? Briefly explain your changes.
Adds scipy connected_components function to the is_fully_connected method (used on scipy csr_matrix and np.ndarray), else uses the original networkx is_connected method (on nx graphs)
#### Any other comments?
Notebook for reference:
https://nbviewer.jupyter.org/github/kareef928/graspologic-personal/blob/main/notebooks/nx-vs-scipy.ipynb
